generation

Class Cells

  • java.lang.Object
    • generation.Cells

  • public class Cells
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates all access to a grid of cells. Each cell encodes whether walls or borders/bounds to rooms or to the outer border of the maze exist. The internal two-dimensional array matches with a grid of cells as follows: cells[0,y] form the left border, hence there is a wall on left. cells[width-1,y] form the right border, hence there is a wall on right. cells[x,0] form the top border, hence there is a wall on top. cells[x,height-1] form the bottom border, hence there is a wall on bottom. The upper left corner is seen as position [0][0]. Warning: MapDrawer locates (0,0) in located at the bottom-left corner. Note that for a calculated maze, at least one cell on the border will have a missing wall for an exit somewhere. Walls and borders are separated concepts. A border is not removed by the maze generation procedure. It is used to mark the outside border of the maze as well as those walls of internal rooms that should remain in place. One can think of the border attribute as a little sticker on a wall that says "leave this wall in place". Walls can be taken down by the maze generation procedure. The internal encoding of walls for each cell into a single integer per cell is performed with bit operations (&,|) and thus error prone. An encapsulation within this class localizes all bit operations for this encoding. This code is refactored code from Maze.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes. The class resulted from refactoring the int[][] cells area in the original Maze and Mazebuilder classes into a class of its own. Refactored by Peter Kemper

      • canGo

        public boolean canGo(Wall wall)
        checks if cell (x,y) and adjacent neighbor in the given direction are not separated by a border and the neighbor has not been visited before.
        Parameters:
        wall - provides (x,y) coordinates for cell and the direction
        Returns:
        true if neighbor in the given direction is new and wall can be taken down, false otherwise

        Parameters:

        y - coordinate of cell
        Returns:

      • isInRoom

        public boolean isInRoom(int x,
                        int y)
        Tells if the given position is inside a room. This is false after cells.initialize() and before calling setInRoomToOne() or markAreaAsRoom().
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of cell
        y - coordinate of cell
        Returns:
        true if (x,y) position resides in an area marked as a room before, false otherwise

      • areaOverlapsWithRoom

        public boolean areaOverlapsWithRoom(int rx,
                                    int ry,
                                    int rxl,
                                    int ryl)
        Checks if there is a cell in the given area that belongs to a room. The first corner (rx,ry) is at the upper left position, the second corner (rxl,ryl) is at the lower right position.
        Parameters:
        rx - 1st corner, x coordinate
        ry - 1st corner, y coordinate
        rxl - 2nd corner, x coordinate
        ryl - 2nd corner, y coordinate
        Returns:
        true if area contains a cell that is already in a room or if it is too close to the border, false otherwise

      • markAreaAsRoom

        public void markAreaAsRoom(int rw,
                           int rh,
                           int rx,
                           int ry,
                           int rxl,
                           int ryl)
        Marks a given area as a room on the maze and positions up to five doors randomly. The first corner is at the upper left position, the second corner is at the lower right position. Assumes that given area is located on the map and does not intersect with any existing room. The walls of a room are declared as borders to prevent the generation mechanism from tearing them down. Of course there must be a few segments where doors can be created so the border protection is removed there.
        Parameters:
        rw - room width
        rh - room height
        rx - 1st corner, x coordinate
        ry - 1st corner, y coordinate
        rxl - 2nd corner, x coordinate
        ryl - 2nd corner, y coordinate

      • addWall

        public void addWall(Wall wall,
                    boolean internalWall)
        Add a wall between to adjacent cells (x,y) and (x+dx,y+dy).
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of cell
        y - coordinate of cell
        direction - from given cell to neighbor cell
        internalWall - denotes if wall is added on both cells (true) or just for the given cell (false)

      • deleteWall

        public void deleteWall(Wall wall)
        Delete a wall between to adjacent cells (x,y) and (x+dx,y+dy). Deleting the wall at (x,y) implies that also a wall in opposite direction at (x+dx,y+dy) gets deleted.
        Parameters:
        wall - provides (x,y) coordinate of cell and direction

      • addWallsForSegment

        public void addWallsForSegment(Seg seg,
                               int map_unit)
        Add walls in either north or west direction for the given segment. Segment coordinates need to be rescaled by map_unit to translate into cell coordinates. Method is only used to track seen cells in the FirstPersonDrawer for the MapDrawer. So achieved properties for cells object differ than for other methods used to represent the maze.
        Parameters:
        seg - gives the segment whose walls need to be added
        map_unit - gives the scaling factor to obtain the cell coordinates

      • hasWall

        public boolean hasWall(int x,
                       int y,
                       CardinalDirection dir)
        Tells if the given position has a wall in the given direction. This is true after cells.initialize() and before deleting this wall. A wall can be deleted by directly calling deleteWall() or by removing all walls within a room, method markAreaAsRoom().
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of cell
        y - coordinate of cell
        dir - gives the cardinal direction
        Returns:
        true if (x,y) position has wall in the given direction

      • hasNoWall

        public boolean hasNoWall(int x,
                         int y,
                         CardinalDirection dir)
        Tells if the given position has no wall in the given direction. This is true after cells.initialize() and before deleting this wall. A wall can be deleted by directly calling deleteWall() or by removing all walls within a room, method markAreaAsRoom().
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of cell
        y - coordinate of cell
        dir - gives the cardinal direction
        Returns:
        true if (x,y) position has no wall in the given direction
